intro: Hieracium rhodanthum, commonly known as the red-centred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive red center, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium rhodanthum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habit.
